sections.summary: The 'Physical Backbone' of e-commerce. Logistics REITs own the giant warehouses that handle the world's physical goods.
sections.deep_dive: In 2026, Logistics is the only 'Safe' sector in commercial real estate. While office buildings are being converted to apartments, warehouses are being expanded to handle Algorithmic Intelligence-driven inventory management and 2-hour shipping. These facilities are the critical chokepoints of the 'Just-in-Case' economy. Rents are rising faster than inflation because there is a physical limit on how many warehouses can be built near major cities with power access. For macro traders, Logistics REITs are a play on both the 'Consumer' and the 'Supply Chain'. If people are buying things online, these warehouses are the most valuable land on earth.

council_debate.macro: Direct correlation with e-commerce penetration and global retail sales.
council_debate.tech: Fully roboticized 'Dark Warehouses' are the new standard for Class A space.
council_debate.geopolitics: The 'Near-shoring' boom. Warehouses at the US-Mexico and EU-Eastern Europe borders are at 99% occupancy.
council_debate.policy: Zoning and environmental hurdles keep new supply low, protecting the rents of existing owners.
council_debate.quant: Watch 'Lease-spreads'â€”the difference between old rents and new market rents is the primary driver of earnings growth.
council_debate.technical: Historically trades at a premium to the broader REIT index due to superior structural growth.

sections.forecast_risks: A 'Consumer Buyer Strike' where e-commerce volumes drop for the first time in history.
sections.gms_conclusion: The landlords of the modern global supply chain.
